isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - CLEAN

svcsubproc.title: 5.3.1. Ground or Polished Parts

warning.para: If you use cleaning solvents, hot solution tanks or alkaline solutions incorrectly, personal injury can occur. To prevent personal injury, follow the instructions supplied by the manufacturer. Do NOT use gasoline to clean parts. Gasoline can explode.

svcsubproc.para: Use a cleaning solvent to clean ground or polished parts and surfaces. Kerosene or diesel fuel can be used for this purpose DO NOT USE GASOLINE.
Do NOT clean ground or polished parts in a hot solution tank or with water, steam or alkaline solutions. These solutions will cause corrosion of the parts.

svcsubproc.title: 5.3.2. Rough Parts
svcsubproc.para: Rough parts can be cleaned with the ground or polished parts. Rough parts also can be cleaned in hot solution tanks with a weak alkaline solution. Parts must remain in the hot solution tanks until they are completely cleaned and heated.
